message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) from data, which is a common problem in machine learning and statistics. The use of mathematical programming and optimization techniques to solve this problem suggests that it belongs to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of regularization techniques such as $\ell_0$ and $\ell_1$, which are commonly used in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The problem of learning DAGs also has connections to the field of discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and the use of super-structures to reduce the set of possible candidate DAGs suggests a possible connection to the field of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the use of mixed-integer quadratic optimization (MIQO) suggests a possible connection to the field of information theory (cs.IT).
